quest.name: Bitter Snow
journal: The glint in Shirabaht's eyes suggests she was hoping you might pass through.

Though efforts to thwart blasphemies born of the Final Days proceed apace, trouble yet lurks in the snows of Garlemald. Much to Shirabaht's surprise, Sharlayan has requested aid for the Garleans, and though the Ilsabard contingent has already deployed forces to aid them, Shirabaht asks if you might also lend a hand. No sooner do you nod your head in consent than she bids you make for Camp Broken Glass to speak with their intelligence officer.

As Fourchenault explains, a survey team was assembled to assess the moon and its capacity for serving as a repository of knowledge. The presence of what they believe to be a blasphemy, however, keeps them from ascending the Tower of Babil and traveling to their destination. As such, nation leaders, both near and far, have elected to combine their forces to root out this threat. To better assess the situation, Lucia suggests speaking with members of the reconnaissance team that first encountered the blasphemy that bars their path.

Lorens recounts their journey into the tower where they spied the blasphemy and a horde of beasts seemingly at its beck and call. Their attempts to strike it from a distance were foiled by a barrier of unknown origin. Lorens intends to confer with
Kan-E-Senna as to how this protection may be overcome. In the meantime, he asks you to investigate reports of Garleans transforming into monsters. To that end, Fourchenault suggests reconvening with Artoirel.

An investigation into the sightings of newly transformed monsters reveals they were Garleans who hailed from Locus Amoenus, their ancestral homeland. Those who yet remain unchanged by the aftereffects of the Final Days have elected to fend for themselves on the outskirts of the capital. Hoping to learn more of what has caused their countrymen to be overcome by despair, Artoirel has a mind to go and speak with them, and he would be grateful for your company.
objectives: Speak with the intelligence officer at Camp Broken Glass.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Well, if it isn't Forename, all-around good egg and champion of...well, the whole world, I suppose.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Word travels fast, my friend. We've heard all about your exploits defeating the blasphemies that plagued the good people of Eorzea and Doma.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Sadly, there are other fell beasts that yet want for slaying, but fear not─our efforts to bring them low proceed apace, and we've had naught but glad tidings from our allies.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: In fact, we but recently received word from the Resistance forces in Bozja that a blasphemy was slain, thanks in no small part to Lord Hien's timely assistance.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Perhaps the most surprising report came from Werlyt, where soldiers led by the infamous Black Wolf fought alongside Ala Mhigan troops for yet another hard-earned victory.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Reports from Garlemald, however, suggest another blasphemy threat lurks in the snows, and we received a petition for assistance.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Strange, don't you think? When the effects of the Final Days began to spread in earnest, we encountered a great many monsters in Garlemald, but never a blasphemy.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: And to make matters worse, they say the Garleans who chose to remain and rebuild have begun transforming into yet more hideous creatures.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: From what I understand, it was you and your comrades who brought an end to the source of the Final Days, is that right?

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Even so, it would appear its effects will linger a while longer.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Until this malevolent influence on akasa subsides, I daresay this won't be the last time we hear of such sightings.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: As for the blasphemy, we have reason to believe it is a great deal stronger than any we've faced thus far. Your strength and experience would prove quite valuable. If you're willing to help, of course.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Why, of course I'll help!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Is the Ilsabard contingent not equipped to handle this threat?

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Truly? Our contacts in Sharlayan will be thrilled to hear it. Though they did not explicitly request your presence, it was clear from the first they were hoping for it.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: I should certainly think so. No sooner did we receive the request from Sharlayan than they began making preparations to dispatch their forces. That said, it was clear from the first they were hoping you might also take up the hunt.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Though if I may be frank, I was not expecting Sharlayan of all places to be so concerned with the present state of Garlemald, what with their strict policies on nonintervention. Perhaps we'll find out the reason before this is all over.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: But that's an inquiry for another time. I'll not keep you any longer. Once you arrive in Garlemald, I should think the intelligence officer stationed there will be more than happy to apprise you of the situation.

dialogue.name: SHIRABAHT
dialogue.text: Keep your wits about you out there. To have eluded us for so long, this blasphemy is like to be more cunning than most.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER04120
dialogue.text: Forename? The Forename? It's an honor to have you with us, misssir! I presume you're come to assist in our hunt for the blasphemy?

dialogue.name: SOLDIER04120
dialogue.text: Maxima and Lucia will be pleased to hear it. If you would come this way.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: It is good to see you, Forename. Though I wish it were under more fortuitous circumstances.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: We were reluctant to call upon you, knowing you but recently returned from the far reaches of the heavens, but we are no less glad for your aid.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Now then, I believe it best if the man who first discovered this blasphemy explained the situation.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Good. We may forgo introductions, then. Thank you for answering our call for assistance.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: As for the situation at hand, it concerns a joint effort between the Forum and the Loporrits to find new purpose for the moon.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: While there is no longer need for a vessel to evacuate this star, we believe the moon may yet prove of use to the people of Etheirys.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: After much contemplation, a rather ingenious proposal was put forward─to transform the moon into a repository for man's knowledge. An archive of hitherto unseen scale.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Sharlayan has long had the honor of boasting incomparable repositories of the world's knowledge, but it is far from perfect.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Should calamity befall us, natural or otherwise, the wisdom of ages we have long labored to preserve would be lost.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: But the moon is beyond any such risk. What's more, it is beyond the jurisdiction of any one nation.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Thus did we consult the allied nations of Eorzea, the Far East, and Radz-at-Han. They agreed to assembling a survey team to take measure of the moon and its potential as a repository.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Our plans for assessment were forestalled, however, by the presence of an entity we believe to be a blasphemy in the Tower of Babil.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Claims of Garlean citizens transforming into monsters shortly after its discovery only gave further credence to our initial supposition.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: But we've not only ill tidings to share. Reinforcements have been dispatched to aid us in quelling the blasphemy threat.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Lord Artoirel and a member of Gridania's Keepers of the Entwined Serpents have already begun an investigation into the catalyst of these transformations.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Though the skies no longer burn, and the spread of this affliction is much curtailed, we must remain vigilant.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Until the blasphemy threat has been quelled, Alphinaud and Alisaie have graciously offered to help keep calm the people of Tertium while we attend to the people here.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: But the matter of the blasphemy is not so easily resolved, I am afraid.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: We recently met with certain...complications that have hindered our plans. Yugiri and Fordola are presently deliberating how best to resolve the situation. Perhaps it would be best if you heard the details directly from them.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: I should like to join you, if I may. As this endeavor was originally undertaken on Sharlayan's behalf, I feel it is my responsibility to see this through to its conclusion.

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: Hmph. Somehow I should've known you would turn up eventually.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: I did not expect to see you here of all places, but I am no less glad for your presence.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: I presume word of the blasphemy is what brought you here. In which case, I believe it may be best if a member of the reconnaissance team's guard explained the situation.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: An acquaintance of yours?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Long time no see, Lorens.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Aren't you the captain of the Company of Heroes?

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: I'd heard tell ye were the worldly sort, but bugger me if I know where ye heard my name before. Ahem...

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: I'm just a lowly sword for hire, hopin' to fatten my purse with a touch o' mercenary work after takin' my leave from Limsa. The job sounded simple enough, but...well. I'm sure ye wouldn't be here if it were, eh?

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Who? Me? Heavens no! Just a lowly sword for hire, hopin' to fatten my purse with a touch o' mercenary work after takin' my leave from Limsa.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: I reckon ye'd sooner find Mistbeard's treasure than the Company o' Heroes' captain, and neither have reason to make themselves known, lasslad.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: But ye didn't come all this way to hear about me, did ye? The blasphemy we're after is making its nest in the upper reaches of the Tower of Babil. The auxiliary sector, I believe it was.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: But it wasn't alone─a sizable horde o' beasts were circlin' about like knights protectin' their queen. Naturally, we thought to strike from a distance before engagin' in earnest, but not a single bullet reached its mark.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: They were protected by some manner o' mystical shroud as far as I could figure. Without a keen eye for magic, I don't see anyone gettin' through.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: By the time we understood the futility o' the situation, we'd been spotted. Retreat was our only option.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Pains me to say it, but there won't be any brute forcin' our way through this one.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: My understanding was that, once transformed, these blasphemies are completely devoid of aether. With what energies could it create such a barrier?

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: That's the question, isn't it? My first thought was some heretofore unknown technique for conjurin' shields. Needless to say, I'm out o' my depth when it comes to matters o' magic.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Which is precisely why I plan to speak with the Elder Seedseer when she arrives. If anyone can help us find a way to overcome the blasphemy's protection, it's her.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: In the meantime, could we trouble you to help with the not-so-small matter o' people changin' into beasts? The blasphemy's horde was large enough when first we found it. We can't afford for more to join its ranks.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Very well. We shall reconvene with Lord Artoirel and discuss strategy.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Ah, before you go... There's somethin' else you should know about the tower. From the moment we set foot inside, I could swear there was someone...or something watchin' us.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: I shrugged it off, thinkin' it a figment o' my imagination, but... In hindsight, I'm not so sure.

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Nothin' to worry ourselves about now, but best keep on your guard when we do finally return to the tower, eh?

dialogue.name: LORENS
dialogue.text: Gods... Wh-What I wouldn't give f-for a nice, hot bowl of s-s-soup.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Lord Hien will be arriving ere long. Aptly dressed for the cold, I should hope. Gosetsu would no doubt count himself fortunate to be absent if he knew we were here.

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: Arenvald sends his regards, by the way. He asked me to tell you not to push yourself, but we all know what a waste of breath that'll prove to be.

dialogue.name: KEEPEROFTHEENTWINEDSERPENTS
dialogue.text: Under normal circumstances, I would never dream of leaving the Elder Seedseer's side, but considering the nature of these blasphemies and the calamity they bring, she insisted a representative for Gridania precede her arrival.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: It would appear their investigation into the recent reports of refugees transforming is well underway.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. 'Tis good to have you with us, my friend.

dialogue.name: KEEPEROFTHEENTWINEDSERPENTS
dialogue.text: Indeed. The road before us is not an easy one, and a womanman of your talents will prove invaluable to our efforts.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: We but recently returned from reconnaissance, wherein we made a few rather surprising discoveries.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: First and foremost, we were pleased to discover that no one residing within Camp Broken Glass or Tertium have turned, no doubt thanks to the concerted efforts of Maxima, Alphinaud, and Alisaie.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: However, we have reason to believe those who did turn all hail from Locus Amoenus.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: You mean Corvos, the Garleans' ancestral home?

dialogue.name: KEEPEROFTHEENTWINEDSERPENTS
dialogue.text: The very same. When the ill effects of the Final Days began to manifest there, a number of Garlean refugees from the region sought sanctuary in Garlemald.

dialogue.name: KEEPEROFTHEENTWINEDSERPENTS
dialogue.text: But the capital was already in ruins when they arrived. They were offered asylum, but many refused and instead chose to fend for themselves on the outskirts of the city.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: We are of a mind to go and speak with them directly if you would care to join us. Perhaps together we can learn what of their recent circumstances has triggered such terrible change among their people.
